      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <V> V callMethod(java.lang.reflect.Method method, java.lang.Object object, java.lang.Object... args) 
      static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getAllNamesAndValuesOfObject(java.lang.Object o, ReflectionOptions options)
      Invoke all getters of an Object and put them into a Map with the Getter's friendly name as the key, and its returned value as the value
      static <T> java.util.Set<java.lang.reflect.Method> getUserFriendlyPublicGetters(java.lang.Class<T> clazz, ReflectionOptions<T> options)
      Get all of the public Getter Methods of a Class that are deemed to be friendly to expose to the User A Method is classified as a public Getter and User-Friendly if:
      1) The name of the Method contains "get" - Accessor functions are not supported
      2) The method returns something other than an Object of void type
      3) The method's access modifier is public - if it is not, the data it returns is assumed to be for internal use, hence the encapsulation
      4) The method must have a parameter count of 0
      5) The method inherited from Object - "getClass" is not included as Class objects are not considered useful or friendly to show to the User
      6) Because of this, if the supplied "clazz" is of type Class, an empty Set will be returned, as the method Class.getClassLoader() causes StackOverflow errors.
      static boolean isSimpleType(java.lang.Class clazz)
      Check if a given class is of a "simple" type, meaning: 1) It is a wrapper of a Primitive Type such as Integer 2) It represents a Primitive Type, such as int.class 3) It is an Enum or a String - Strings are classified as simple as they can be easily made user-friendly with String.toString()
      static boolean isSimpleType(java.lang.Object o) 
      static java.lang.Object valueOfField(java.lang.reflect.Field field, java.lang.Object retrieveValuesFrom)

    • Method Detail

      • isSimpleType

        public static boolean isSimpleType(java.lang.Class clazz)
        Check if a given class is of a "simple" type, meaning: 1) It is a wrapper of a Primitive Type such as Integer 2) It represents a Primitive Type, such as int.class 3) It is an Enum or a String - Strings are classified as simple as they can be easily made user-friendly with String.toString()
        Parameters:
        clazz - The Class to check
        Returns:
        If the given Class is of a simple type

      • isSimpleType

        public static boolean isSimpleType(java.lang.Object o)

      • getUserFriendlyPublicGetters

        public static <T> java.util.Set<java.lang.reflect.Method> getUserFriendlyPublicGetters(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                                                                                       ReflectionOptions<T> options)
        Get all of the public Getter Methods of a Class that are deemed to be friendly to expose to the User A Method is classified as a public Getter and User-Friendly if:
        1) The name of the Method contains "get" - Accessor functions are not supported
        2) The method returns something other than an Object of void type
        3) The method's access modifier is public - if it is not, the data it returns is assumed to be for internal use, hence the encapsulation
        4) The method must have a parameter count of 0
        5) The method inherited from Object - "getClass" is not included as Class objects are not considered useful or friendly to show to the User
        6) Because of this, if the supplied "clazz" is of type Class, an empty Set will be returned, as the method Class.getClassLoader() causes StackOverflow errors.

        Caching is in place to speed up the otherwise slow reflexive operations, so if any dynamic class modification is done at runtime, it is not guaranteed to update. Alternatively, the WeakReferences to the Class may be destroyed upon modification, causing new Getter generation

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of Class
        Parameters:
        clazz - The Class to retrieve public, user-friendly Getters of
        options - Includes a list of Methods to ignore, which will be removed from the Set. No other fields of ReflectionOptions are used
        Returns:
        A sometimes empty Set of all of the Class's getters

      • getAllNamesAndValuesOfObject

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getAllNamesAndValuesOfObject(java.lang.Object o,
                                                                                            ReflectionOptions options)
        Invoke all getters of an Object and put them into a Map with the Getter's friendly name as the key, and its returned value as the value

        No caching is used as some getters may not always return the same value if the Object changes state.

        Parameters:
        o - The Object
        options - Options to use
        Returns:
        The map
